description:
An array of data points for the series. For the bullet series type, points can be given in the following ways:

  1. An array of arrays with 3 or 2 values. In this case, the values correspond to x,y,target. If the first value is a string, it is applied as the name of the point, and the x value is inferred. The x value can also be omitted, in which case the inner arrays should be of length 2. Then the x value is automatically calculated, either starting at 0 and incremented by 1, or from pointStart and pointInterval given in the series options.

    data: [
    [0, 40, 75],
    [1, 50, 50],
    [2, 60, 40]
]

  2. An array of objects with named values. The following snippet shows only a few settings, see the complete options set below. If the total number of data points exceeds the series' turboThreshold, this option is not available.

    data: [{
    x: 0,
    y: 40,
    target: 75,
    name: "Point1",
    color: "#00FF00"
}, {
     x: 1,
    y: 60,
    target: 40,
    name: "Point2",
    color: "#FF00FF"
}]

children.name: accessibility
children.description: Accessibility options for a data point.

children.name: borderColor
children.description:
The color of the border surrounding the column or bar.

In styled mode, the border stroke can be set with the .highcharts-point rule.

children.name: borderWidth
children.description:
The width of the border surrounding the column or bar.

In styled mode, the stroke width can be set with the .highcharts-point rule.

children.name: className
children.description: An additional, individual class name for the data point's graphic representation.

children.name: color
children.description:
Individual color for the point. By default the color is pulled from the global colors array.

In styled mode, the color option doesn't take effect. Instead, use colorIndex.

children.name: colorIndex
children.description: A specific color index to use for the point, so its graphic representations are given the class name highcharts-color-{n}. In styled mode this will change the color of the graphic. In non-styled mode, the color by is set by the fill attribute, so the change in class name won't have a visual effect by default.

children.name: custom
children.description: A reserved subspace to store options and values for customized functionality. Here you can add additional data for your own event callbacks and formatter callbacks.

samples.name: Point and series with custom data

children.name: dashStyle
children.description:
A name for the dash style to use for the column or bar. Overrides dashStyle on the series.

In styled mode, the stroke dash-array can be set with the same classes as listed under data.color.

children.name: dataLabels
children.description: Individual data label for each point. The options are the same as the ones for plotOptions.series.dataLabels.

samples.name: Show a label for the last value

children.name: description
children.description: A description of the point to add to the screen reader information about the point.

children.name: dragDrop
children.description: Point specific options for the draggable-points module. Overrides options on series.dragDrop.

children.name: drilldown
children.description: The id of a series in the drilldown.series array to use for a drilldown for this point.

children.name: events
children.description: The individual point events.

children.name: id
children.description: An id for the point. This can be used after render time to get a pointer to the point object through chart.get().

children.name: labelrank
children.description: The rank for this point's data label in case of collision. If two data labels are about to overlap, only the one with the highest labelrank will be drawn.

children.name: name
children.description: The name of the point as shown in the legend, tooltip, dataLabels, etc.

children.name: pointWidth
children.description: A pixel value specifying a fixed width for the column or bar. Overrides pointWidth on the series. The width effects the dimension that is not based on the point value.

children.name: selected
children.description: Whether the data point is selected initially.

children.name: target
children.description: The target value of a point.

children.name: targetOptions
children.description: Individual target options for each point.

children.name: x
children.description: The x value of the point. For datetime axes, the X value is the timestamp in milliseconds since 1970.

children.name: y
children.description: The y value of the point.
